subject: Re: Fwd: [Action required] Security update for the WooCommerce Stripe Payment Gateway

full_threads.body:
Hi Dimitri,

No problem at all, we’ve got it covered.

We’ll update you as soon as the staging environment is updated and the latest WooCommerce Stripe plugin is safely pushed to live.

Let me know if there's anything else you need in the meantime, always happy to help!

Thanks team

Dimitri Galanis

Managing Director

dimitri@pointdot.com.au

02 9171 4990

0419 707 061

106 Homer Street, Earlwood

pointdot.com.au
thanks for flagging this kuya @manuel - confirmed by @joel that it is indeed critical ( we can't apply the updates to the live site as it may break it) 🙏

Hi Dimitri,

Happy Friday, and thanks again for sending those Stripe instructions through!

Just a quick update, we’re currently working on the changes in staging.

The Belmore Cakes site is running on an older setup, so we’ve run into a few compatibility issues while updating the plugin.

Here’s what we’ve done so far:
  • Implemented the Stripe update in the staging environment
  • Identified a few conflicts due to the site's older codebase
  • Working now to make the site compatible with the latest plugin version

We’ll keep you posted and confirm once everything’s updated and tested. Appreciate your patience while we sort through this!

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Allie Borcena

full_threads.body:
@allieB @joel

After updating the plugins on the staging site, the display of the website looks good and everything appears to be working as expected. However, I did notice an error in the logs related to the WooCommerce Gateway. I’m not certain if this error is critical or safe to ignore, so I recommend reviewing it further to ensure there are no hidden issues... please check below.

https://stg-belmorecakes-staging.kinsta.cloud/

@joel Could you please confirm if it’s okay for me to proceed with applying these updates to the live site? I just want to make sure you’re comfortable before moving forward.
great thank you @joel - passing to @manuel , please make this a priority 🙏 thank you so much
Hi @allieB @manuel, create a fresh staging and update will update there, please check it thoroughly as the site has a few issue before, lets try and fix it in staging first.
Hey kuya @joel - could you confirm if this is safe to update (woocommerce) - once confirmed I'll update the plugin 🙏

Hi Dimitri,

Thanks for sending this through. We’ll work on the Stripe plugin update for Belmore Cakes and come back to you with confirmation once it’s completed.

Best,
Lance

Hi Team,

Can you follow these instructions from STRIPE for Belmore Cakes and update the plugin. Please confirm once completed.

Thank you,
Dimitri

Hello,



In 2025, you processed payments using an old version of the WooCommerce Stripe Payment Gateway. Stripe now requires a security update for this plugin. You'll need to update your plugin version to at least 9.8 and re-authenticate using Stripe by 15 October 2025, to continue getting essential performance and feature enhancements.



Updating requires no code changes and takes only a few minutes.



The updated plugin also includes Stripe Optimized Checkout Suite, a payments experience optimised for conversion. It also includes popular payment methods, AI models that dynamically show the most relevant payment methods to optimise conversion, and Link, a wallet built by Stripe.



Next steps



Sign in to the WordPress Admin Dashboard and make the requested changes:




1.

Update your plugin: From the sidebar, go to the Plugins page. Click Update available, then find and update the WooCommerce Stripe Payment Gateway.



2.

Re-authenticate: Go to the Payments tab in your WooCommerce settings. Click the Stripe payment method, then go to the Settings tab. Click Re-authenticate.



3.

Turn on the Optimized Checkout Suite: Go back to the Payments tab in your WooCommerce settings page. Click the Stripe payment method. Under Advanced settings, select Enable Optimised Checkout Suite and save the changes.



4.

Test the changes.




These instructions above only apply to the WooCommerce Stripe Payment Gateway, which you may have downloaded from the WordPress Plugin directory or WooCommerce Marketplace.



If you no longer use the plugin



If you don't use the WooCommerce Stripe Payment Gateway, for your security, follow the documentation to disconnect the plugin and remove the Stripe API keys.



If you have any questions, please visit our support page or reply to this email and a WooCommerce Happiness Engineer will be glad to help.



- The Stripe and WooCommerce teams




Stripe emails you about important updates, like plugin requirements. If you no longer use the WooCommerce Stripe Payment Gateway in your site, you can disregard this email. If you have an account located in the EEA/UK: Stripe Payments Europe, Limited is an Irish limited company with registered number 513174 and a registered office at 3 Dublin Landings, North Wall Quay, Dublin 1, D01 C4E0, Ireland.
